tools.description: Creates a new Stitch project. A project is a container for UI designs and frontend code.

properties.title: @{description=Optional. The title of the project.; type=string}

tools.name: create_project

$defs.DesignTheme: @{description=The theme of the design.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ProjectMetadata: @{description=Metadata relating to the project.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ScreenInstance: @{description=An instance of a screen on the project. Next ID: 15; properties=; type=object}
$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

outputSchema.description: A project is a single app.

properties.backgroundTheme: @{description=Optional. The background theme of the project.; type=string}
properties.createTime: @{description=Output only. The time when the project was created.; format=date-time; readOnly=True; type=string}
properties.designTheme: @{$ref=#/$defs/DesignTheme; description=Output only. The theme used to generate the first design in the project.; readOnly=True}
properties.deviceType: @{description=Output only. The device type of the project.; enum=System.Object[]; readOnly=True; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.name: @{description=Identifier. The resource name of the project. Format: projects/{project}; type=string; x-google-identifier=True}
properties.origin: @{description=Output only. The origin of the project.; enum=System.Object[]; readOnly=True; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.projectType: @{description=Optional. The type of the project. If not specified, the project is a text to UI project.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.readTime: @{description=Output only. The time the project was last read. Populated only when listing recently viewed projects.; format=date-time; readOnly=True; type=string}
properties.screenInstances: @{description=Output only. The screen instances on this project.; items=; readOnly=True; type=array}
properties.thumbnailScreenshot: @{$ref=#/$defs/File; description=Optional. The screenshot to be used as the thumbnail for the project. Same as normal design screenshots, this contains the FIFE serving_base_url which requires additional FIFE URL options to be set for sizing.}
properties.title: @{description=Optional. The title of the project.; type=string}
properties.updateTime: @{description=Output only. The time when the project was last updated.; format=date-time; readOnly=True; type=string}
properties.visibility: @{description=Optional. The visibility setting of the project.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}

tools.description: Lists all Stitch projects accessible to the user. By default, it lists projects owned by the user.

properties.filter: @{description=Optional. A filter to apply to the list of projects, following a subset of AIP-160. This service supports filtering on the `view` field. Supported filters: * `view=owned`: Lists only projects owned by the user. This is the default behavior if no filter is specified. * `view=shared`: Lists only projects shared with the user. Example: `view=owned`; type=string}

tools.name: list_projects

$defs.DesignTheme: @{description=The theme of the design.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.Project: @{description=A project is a single app.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ProjectMetadata: @{description=Metadata relating to the project.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ScreenInstance: @{description=An instance of a screen on the project. Next ID: 15; properties=; type=object}
$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

properties.projects: @{description=The projects for the given user, sorted by update time from the most recent to the least recent. Adding a new session to an existing project is considered as an update to the project.; items=; type=array}

tools.description: Lists all screens within a given Stitch project.

properties.projectId: @{description=Required. Identifier. The project ID to list screens for, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.; type=string; x-google-identifier=True}

tools.name: list_screens

$defs.Screen: @{description=A screen generated by the agent.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

properties.screens: @{description=The screens for the given project.; items=; type=array}

tools.description: Retrieves the details of a specific screen within a project.

properties.name: @{description=Required. Identifier. The resource name of the screen to retrieve. Format: `projects/{project}/screens/{screen}` Example: `projects/4044680601076201931/screens/98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61`; type=string; x-google-identifier=True}
properties.projectId: @{deprecated=True; description=Required. The project ID of screen to retrieve. Example: `4044680601076201931`, without the `projects/` prefix.; type=string}
properties.screenId: @{deprecated=True; description=Required. The screen ID of screen to retrieve. Example: `98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61`, without the `screens/` prefix.; type=string}

tools.name: get_screen

$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

outputSchema.description: A screen generated by the agent.

properties.deviceType: @{description=Output only. The device type of the screen.; enum=System.Object[]; readOnly=True; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.htmlCode: @{$ref=#/$defs/File; description=The HTML code of the screen.}
properties.name: @{description=Identifier. The name of the screen. Format: projects/{project}/screens/{screen}; type=string; x-google-identifier=True}
properties.title: @{description=Output only. The title of the screen.; readOnly=True; type=string}

tools.description:
Generates a new screen within a project from a text prompt.

**Instructions for Tool Call:**
*  This action can take a few minutes to complete. Please be patient. DO NOT RETRY.
*  If the tool call fails due to connection error, the generation process may still succeed. Please try to get the screen with `get_screen` method later.

**Output:**
*  **`output_components`**: If `output_components` contains text, return it to the user. If `output_components` contains suggestions (e.g. "Yes, make them all"), present these suggestions to the user. If the user accepts one of the suggestions, call `generate_screen_from_text` again with `prompt` set to the accepted suggestion.

properties.deviceType: @{description=The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.modelId: @{description=Optional. The model to use for generation.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.projectId: @{description=Required. The project ID to generate the screen for, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.; type=string}
properties.prompt: @{description=Required. The input text to generate the screen from.; type=string}

tools.name: generate_screen_from_text

$defs.BoundingBox: @{description=The bounding box of a component.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ComponentRegion: @{description=The region of a component region.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.Design: @{description=A generated design, which is a collection of multiple screens. Note: do not add new fields to this message or rely on it for any logic. For any Screen property, add it to Screen message instead. Design is a deprecated hierarchical container for screens and is only used for backward compatibility.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.DesignSystem: @{description=Represents a collection of guidelines, design tokens, and reusable components that define the visual and functional characteristics of a product's design. This is used to guide the generation of consistent and branded designs.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.DesignTheme: @{description=The theme of the design.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ScreenMetadata: @{description=The metadata of a screen.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.SessionOutputComponent: @{description=A partial output of the session.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

properties.projectId: @{description=The project ID of the generated screen. This is the same as the input project ID.; type=string}
properties.sessionId: @{description=The session ID of the generated screen.; type=string}

tools.description:
Edits existing screens within a project using a text prompt.

**Instructions for Tool Call:**
*  This action can take a few minutes to complete. Please be patient. DO NOT RETRY.
*  If the tool call fails due to connection error, the process may still succeed.

properties.deviceType: @{description=Optional. The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.modelId: @{description=Optional. The model to use for generation.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.projectId: @{description=Required. The project ID of screens to edit, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.; type=string}
properties.prompt: @{description=Required. The input text to generate the screen from.; type=string}
properties.selectedScreenIds: @{description=Required. The screen IDs of screens to edit, example: ['98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61', '98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f62'], without the `screens/` prefix.; items=; type=array}

tools.name: edit_screens

$defs.BoundingBox: @{description=The bounding box of a component.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ComponentRegion: @{description=The region of a component region.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.Design: @{description=A generated design, which is a collection of multiple screens. Note: do not add new fields to this message or rely on it for any logic. For any Screen property, add it to Screen message instead. Design is a deprecated hierarchical container for screens and is only used for backward compatibility.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.DesignSystem: @{description=Represents a collection of guidelines, design tokens, and reusable components that define the visual and functional characteristics of a product's design. This is used to guide the generation of consistent and branded designs.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.DesignTheme: @{description=The theme of the design.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.ScreenMetadata: @{description=The metadata of a screen.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.SessionOutputComponent: @{description=A partial output of the session.; properties=; type=object}
$defs.UserFeedback: @{description=User feedback for a given interaction.; properties=; type=object}

outputSchema.description: The output design generated by the agent.

properties.projectId: @{description=The project ID of the generated screen. This is the same as the input project ID.; type=string}
properties.sessionId: @{description=The session ID of the generated screen.; type=string}

tools.description: Generates variants of existing screens within a project using a text prompt.

$defs.VariantOptions: @{description=Configuration options for design variant generation. This message captures all parameters used to generate variants, allowing the configuration to be stored, replayed, or analyzed.; properties=; type=object}

properties.deviceType: @{description=Optional. The type of device that captured the screenshot, e.g., mobile or desktop.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.modelId: @{description=Optional. The model to use for generation.; enum=System.Object[]; type=string; x-google-enum-descriptions=System.Object[]}
properties.projectId: @{description=Required. The project ID of screens to generate variants for, example: '4044680601076201931', without the `projects/` prefix.; type=string}
properties.prompt: @{description=Required. The input text used to generate the variants.; type=string}
properties.selectedScreenIds: @{description=Required. The screen ids of screen to generate variants for, example: ['98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f61', '98b50e2ddc9943efb387052637738f62'], without the `screens/` prefix.; items=; type=array}
properties.variantOptions: @{$ref=#/$defs/VariantOptions; description=Required. The variant options for generation, including the number of variants, creative range, and aspects to focus on.}
